snippet: Fokker Services had been accused of more than 1,150 violations of American sanctions on Iran and Sudan through the illicit sale of aircraft parts.
abstract: Unit of Fokker Technologies of the Netherlands, leading aerospace company and Pentagon contractor, agrees to pay $21 million in penalties to settle accusations it repeatedly violated United States sanctions on sales of aircraft parts to Iran and Sudan.
lead_paragraph: Fokker Services had been accused of more than 1,150 violations of American sanctions on Iran and Sudan through the illicit sale of aircraft parts.

headline.main: Company Fined $21 Million for Selling Parts to Iran
headline.print_headline: $21 Million for Selling Parts to Iran
